item.title: Otago University students drinking less - Radio New Zealand
item.description:
Otago University students drinking less  Radio New Zealand

Otago University students aren't drinking until they're drunk as much in past years, a study has found.

item.title: Otago University seizes and destroys copies of student magazine depicting menstruation - The Guardian
item.description:
Otago University seizes and destroys copies of student magazine depicting menstruation  The Guardian

Staff from New Zealand’s oldest university have conducted a night-time raid to seize and destroy every copy of a student magazine, fearing that an illustration of a person menstruating on the cover would be “objectionable to many people.” On Monday night staff seized more than 500 copies of the student magazine Critic from across the campus and dumped them in a large bin. Critic editor Joel MacManus and his staff had no idea what happened to the copies of the special menstruation issue, and spent Tuesday trying to access campus CCTV footage to identify who had taken them. Related: New Zeala...

item.title: So my younger self was right: colouring in is the key to a happy life - The Guardian
item.description:
So my younger self was right: colouring in is the key to a happy life  The Guardian

As a small, Meatloaf-looking girl, often to be found wearing an unlikely collection of bottle-green leggings, DM boots and silk waistcoats (imagine a radical feminist Status Quo), I absolutely loved colouring in. I would spend ages on the sort of intricate geometric patterns that would have been perfect training for a career in carpet design. Related: Colouring books for adults benefit mental health, study suggests I well remember the warm, porridge-like mental state that came on as I sat under my beloved Mr Men sleeping bag, an untouched bowl of orange quarters and sunflower seeds to my ri...
